explanation: Agent A is essentially correct, with an important clarification. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 requires that pointer types be declared to point to const-qualified objects whenever the pointed-to object is not modified. In calculate_nonce many of the arguments passed to digest_update (rnd, uri, realm, pointers into sockaddr_storage, and the string literal "\0") are conceptually read-only. If digest_update is declared to take a non-const data pointer (for example void * or char *), that declaration is inappropriate per Rule 8.13 and should be changed to take a const-qualified pointer (for example const void * or const char *). The problematic aspect is the digest_update declaration, not the call sites per se; the calls merely expose the mismatch (and passing read-only data such as a string literal to a non-const parameter is semantically wrong under MISRA). Note also: although in standard C a string literal has type char[] (not const char[]), the object is not modifiable and MISRA coding guidelines expect APIs that do not modify such data to use const. If digest_update is already declared to accept a const-qualified pointer, there is no MISRA 8.13 violation. Otherwise the report is correct and the digest_update prototype should be updated to use a const pointer.
